alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 3:42AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine, including the following counties, in west central Maine, Somerset. In western Maine, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Small streams rising quickly. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in mainly minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Farmington, Jackman, Eustis, Coburn Gore, Madison, Jay, Kingfield, Bingham, Carrabassett Valley and Phillips.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
